{{for|the figure in Argentine tango|Figures of Argentine tango#Boleos}} {{Orphan|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox company |name = Voleo Inc. |logo = Voleo Logo.png |type = Private |industry = [[Computer software]] |foundation = 2013 |location_city = [[Vancouver, British Columbia]] |location_country = Canada |subsid = Voleo USA, Inc. |area_served = USA (live platform), Global (simulator) |key_people = Thomas Beattie (Chief Executive Officer)
Mark Morabito (Executive Chairman)
Jay Sujir (Chairman) |num_employees = 2-10 |homepage = {{Url |www.myvoleo.com}} }} Mobile-focused [[fintech]] company '''Voleo Inc.''' specializes in [[smartphone]] stock trading apps for investment clubs, enabling users to form teams with people they trust to democratically manage a portfolio in publicly traded securities.{{cite web|title=Official Website|url=https://www.myvoleo.com/#aboutvoleo}} '''Voleo Inc.''' is privately held and is based in Vancouver, BC, Canada.{{cite web|title=Company Page|url=https://www.linkedin.com/company-beta/4857951/|website=LinkedIn|accessdate=5 May 2017}} Voleo USA Inc, is a FINRA registered broker-dealer,{{cite web|title=FINRA Website|url=https://files.brokercheck.finra.org/firm/firm_273027.pdf|website=FINRA}} and is a wholly owned subsidiary of Voleo, Inc.{{cite web|title=Voleo Announces Completion of State Registration|url=http://www.marketwired.com/press-release/voleo-announces-completion-of-state-registration-2201068.htm|website=Market Wired|date=7 March 2017}} Voleo USA is registered with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission and is a member of the Securities Investor Protection Corporation (SIPC).{{cite web|title=SIPC Website|url=http://www.sipc.org/list-of-members?query=voleo|website=Securities Investor Protection Corporation}} ==History== Voleo was founded in 2013 in Vancouver, BC. Founder Jay Sujir, Chairman, recruited co-founders Mark Morabito, Executive Chairman, and Thomas Beattie, CEO to bring the concept to market. The company’s senior technology team is led by Anthony Tsui, VP Technology, and Gordon Jones, VP Product.{{cite web|title=People who work at Voleo|url=https://www.linkedin.com/search/results/people/?facetCurrentCompany=%224857951%22|website=LinkedIn}} In October 2015, Voleo launched a simulated university trading competition in collaboration with [[Toronto Stock Exchange]] (TSX) and TSX Venture Exchange (TSXV), with the results announced in 2016. Over two thousand students participated in this inaugural event.{{cite web|title=Voleo and Toronto Stock Exchange Announce Equity Trading Competition|url=https://www.tmx.com/newsroom/press-releases?id=373|website=TMX Group|date=27 October 2015}}{{cite web|title=Voleo TSX Equity Trading Competition|url=https://www.myvoleo.com/tsx/}} Voleo was part of Accenture’s FinTech Innovation Lab London 2016.{{cite web|title=Voleo Accepted into Accenture’s FinTech Innovation Lab London|url=https://techvibes.com/2016/01/06/voleo-accepted-into-accentures-fintech-innovation-lab-london-2016-01-06|website=TechVibes|date=6 January 2016}}{{cite web|title=Accenture FinTech Innovation Lab London Participants|url=http://www.fintechinnovationlablondon.co.uk/participants.aspx|website=FinTech Innovation Lab|accessdate=5 May 2017}} In the ensuing months, Voleo prepared its apps for live trading and commenced the registration of subsidiary Voleo USA.{{cite web|title=FINRA BrokerCheck - Voleo USA Inc|url=https://brokercheck.finra.org/firm/summary/273027|website=FINRA}} In March 2017, Voleo announced the completion of US State registrations for its subsidiary Voleo USA.{{cite web|title=Voleo Announces Completion of State Registration|url=http://www.marketwired.com/press-release/voleo-announces-completion-of-state-registration-2201068.htm|website=Market Wired}} Most recently, Voleo won Best of Show for its white-label platform at Finovate Fall 2017 in New York,{{cite web|title=Finovate - Demo Video Archives|url=http://finovate.com/videos/finovatefall-2017-voleo/|website=Finovate}} was selected for PlugAndPlay's Fintech Accelerator.{{cite web|title=Plug and Play Tech Center|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_cGyIr9P1YA|website=YouTube}} In December 2017, Voleo along with Nasdaq completed an inaugural equity trading competition, and the winning team was joined by host representatives for a tour of Nasdaq's Market Site in Times Square in February 2018.{{Cite web|url=http://www.bankingtech.com/1014092/voleo-and-nasdaq-to-launch-equity-trading-competition/|title=Voleo and Nasdaq to launch equity trading competition » Banking Technology|website=www.bankingtech.com|access-date=2017-10-10}} ==Products== The Voleo stock trading app for investment clubs is available in the United States through the Google Play Store {{cite web|title=Google Play Store - Voleo|url=https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.voleo.android&hl=en|website=Google Play}} and Apple App Store.{{cite web|title=iTunes - Voleo|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/voleo/id1006258790?mt=8|website=iTunes}} The Voleo app allows users to create clubs with 3-100 people, propose, discuss, and vote on trades. All customer accounts and assets are held by APEX Clearing Corporation, who are the fully disclosed carrying broker of introducing broker Voleo USA, Inc.{{cite web|title=FINRA BrokerCheck - Voleo|url=https://files.brokercheck.finra.org/firm/firm_273027.pdf|website=FINRA}} Voleo SimuTrader is a free investment club simulator available internationally through the Google Play Store{{cite web|title=Google Play Store - Voleo SimuTrader|url=https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.myvoleo.simutrader&hl=en|website=Google Play}} and Apple App Store.{{cite web|title=iTunes - Voleo SimuTrader|url=https://itunes.apple.com/ca/app/voleo-simutrader/id1111399203?mt=8|website=iTunes}} The Voleo SimuTrader allows users to form investment clubs, propose trades, discuss and vote, track performance, and manage decisions in an entirely simulated environment.{{cite web|title=AppAdvice - Voleo SimuTrader|url=https://appadvice.com/app/voleo-simutrader/1111399203|website=AppAdvice}} Both Voleo apps track decisions made by club members and assigns a score to each member, known as a Definitive Return on Investment Decisions (DROID) score. This enables users to learn while feeding a community where top performing individuals as well as clubs can be followed in real time for investment ideas. These ideas can then be vetted with their trusted peers.{{cite web|title=Making equities investing accessible to a new generation|url=http://www.cbj.ca/voleo/|website=Canadian Business Journal|date=3 March 2017}} ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Financial markets]] [[Category:Financial services companies of Canada]] [[Category:Financial technology companies]] [[Category:Financial services companies of the United States]] [[Category:Online brokerages]] [[Category:Companies based in Vancouver]]
